Title: Video: Passengers Push Train Away From Burning Engine, Coaches In UP
Author: Author
Description: A fire broke out in the engine and two coaches of the Saharanpur-Delhi passenger train today during its halt at the Daurala station in Meerut district of Uttar Pradesh.

Title: "Ready To Evacuate Indian Students From Ukraine": Russia To UN
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: Russia has informed the UN Security Council that Russian buses are ready at crossing points to go to the eastern Ukrainian cities of Kharkiv and Sumy to evacuate Indian students and other foreign nationals who are stranded there.

Title: Foreign Medical Graduates Can Finish Internship In India After Test
Author: NDTV News Desk
Description: In a circular, the National Medical Commission (NMC) said that considering the "agony and stress" faced by these students, their applications may be processed by the state medical councils.

Title: "Be Strong": Indian Embassy's New Assurance To Students In Ukraine's Sumy
Author: NDTV News Desk
Description: Groups of Indian students at the Sumy State University had appealed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi in an emotional plea to save their lives. They claim bombs are being dropped close to their University campus.

Title: "Vote In Large Numbers": PM Modi To Voters On 2nd Phase Of Manipur Election
Author: Asian News International
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today called upon the voters in Manipur to vote in large numbers for the second and final phase of the state Assembly elections, exhorting them to "mark the festival of democracy".

Title: India Logs 5,921 New COVID-19 Cases In Last 24 Hours, 289 Deaths: Centre
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: With 5,921 people testing positive for coronavirus infection in a day, India's total tally of COVID-19 cases now stands at 4,29,57,477 and that of active cases is at 63,878, according to Union Health Ministry data updated on Saturday.

Title: Over 600 Indians Return Home From Ukraine In 3 Air Force Aircraft Today
Author: Rajeev Ranjan
Description: Three Air Force aircraft carrying 629 Indians from Ukraine's neighbouring countries landed at the Hindon air base near Delhi early this morning.

Title: Manipur Assembly Polls LIVE Updates: 1 killed In Poll Violence In Karong Constituency, 28.2% Voter Turnout Recorded Till 11 am
Author: NDTV News Desk
Description: Manipur will pick between 92 candidates in 22 constituencies across 10 districts in the second and last phase of assembly elections today.

Title: 1 Killed In Manipur Poll Violence, 28% Turnout Till 11 am, 16% Less Than In 2017
Author: NDTV News Desk
Description: A person was killed after security forces opened fire when violence broke out during voting in Manipur's Karong constituency today. Manipur is voting to pick among 92 candidates in 22 constituencies across 10 districts.

Title: Coronavirus LIVE Updates: India Records Over 5,900 Fresh COVID-19 Cases
Author: NDTV News Desk
Description: India on Friday reported at least 6,396 new COVID-19 cases while active infections declined to 77,152.

Title: "Holding Talks With Like-Minded Parties Doesn't Mean...": Telangana's KCR
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: Telangana CM K Chandrasekhar Rao said that he is holding talks with like-minded parties to give "a new direction" to nation, but it would be wrong to say now that attempts are being made by regional political outfits to forge an anti-BJP front.

Title: India At UN Cautions Against Attacks On Nuclear Facilities In Ukraine
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: India on Friday cautioned that any accident involving nuclear facilities may have severe consequences for public health and the environment.

Title: Massive Fire Destroys Specialised Hospital In Srinagar, Patients Rescued
Author: Nazir Masoodi
Description: A massive fire completely destroyed Kashmir's biggest orthopaedic hospital on Friday evening.

Title: India Urges Russia And Ukraine For Ceasefire, Seeks To Evacuate Citizens
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: India on Friday sought ceasefire by Russian and Ukrainian troops for evacuation of its citizens from the conflict zones of Kharkiv and Sumy in Ukraine

Title: Thunderstorm With Light To Moderate Rain Likely In Tamil Nadu, Puducherry
Author: Asian News International
Description: Thunderstorm with light to moderate rain is likely to occur at one or two places in several districts of Tamil Nadu and one town of Puducherry within the next three hours, Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC) of Chennai predicted on Friday.

Title: Watch: PM Modi's Tea Break, 'Damru' Session At Mega Varanasi Roadshow
Author: NDTV News Desk
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi stopped for tea as he held a mega roadshow in Varanasi on Friday, drumming up support for BJP candidates ahead of the last phase of the assembly polls in Uttar Pradesh.

Title: Singapore Allows Quarantine-Free Travel For Fully Vaccinated Indian Passengers
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: Singapore on Friday said it has extended the vaccinated travel lane for flights from all Indian cities.

Title: Mumbai Court Denies Bail To Accused In Bulli Bai App Case
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: A sessions court in Mumbai on Friday denied bail to accused Shweta Singh in the Bulli Bai app case.

Title: Centre Explores Ways To Let Medical Students From Ukraine Finish Courses
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: Health Ministry and National Medical Commission are exploring possibility of relaxing provisions of NMC Regulations, 2021 or finding alternatives to enable Ukraine-return medical students complete their courses in private colleges in India or abroad.

Title: Dismissed Cop Destroyed Evidence In Antilia Bomb Scare Case, Says Court
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: A special NIA court while denying bail to dismissed policeman Riyazuddin Kazi, arrested in the Antilia bomb scare case, has held that he had knowledge of the conspiracy hatched for placing explosives near the residence of businessman Mukesh Ambani.

Title: India And Pak Willing To Walk, If Not Work, Together: Government Source
Author: Neeta Sharma
Description: India and Pakistan, south Asian neighbours and archrivals, were among the countries that abstained on a UN resolution that deplored Russia's actions in Ukraine. The two countries are trying to work out their differences, government sources indicate.

Title: Monolithic Microwave Integrated Circuits On Board ISRO Satellite
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: Monolithic microwave integrated circuits developed by the DRDO are on board the EOS04 satellite launched on February 14 by the Indian Space Research Organisation, the Defence Ministry stated on Friday.

Title: Refusal To Get Treatment Ground For Divorce? Supreme Court To Examine
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: Can the refusal of a spouse to acknowledge ailment and refusal to undergo treatment be termed as cruelty and can it become a ground for divorce, the Supreme Court on Friday has agreed to examine.

Title: Not Dharma, PM Seeks Vote On Basis Of Lies: Rahul Gandhi In UP's Varanasi
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi Friday accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of seeking votes on the basis of "lies", and said he now does not talk about his poll promises of doubling farmers' income and generating jobs.

Title: PM Narendra Modi Offers Prayers At Kashi Vishwanath Temple In UP's Varanasi
Author: Asian News International
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday offered prayers at Kashi Vishwanath Temple in Varanasi, after holding a roadshow for the last and the seventh phase of Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections, voting for which is slated to be held on March 7.

Title: Prayers At Srinagar's Iconic Jamia Masjid After Long Shutdown
Author: Nazir Masoodi
Description: The iconic Jamia Masjid in Srinagar - the largest mosque in Kashmir - was today opened for Friday prayers after a long closure over security reasons and pandemic. Over 3,000 men and women attended the congregational prayers, officials said.

Title: National Safety Day 2022: Date, Theme, Significance And Quotes To Mark The Day
Author: NDTV News Desk
Description: The National Safety Day was observed for the first time on March 4, 1972.

Title: Retired Employee Should Not Suffer: Supreme Court In Late Payment Case
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: The Supreme Court Friday directed a Coimbatore-based college to pay interest on the delayed payment of retirement benefits to an associate professor, saying the retired employee should not be made to suffer for no fault of his.

Title: Rajasthan Congress MLA Makes "Threatening Call" To Cop, BJP Raises Uproar
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: A ruling party MLA purportedly abused and threatened the SHO of a police station over phone in Rajasthan's Chittorgarh, allegedly to pressure him to arrest an accused in a case of criminal trespass.

Title: PM Modi Holds Roadshow In Varanasi Ahead Of Last Phase Of Polling In UP
Author: Press Trust of India
Description: Crowds cheered and showered flower petals on Narendra Modi's cavalcade as he held a mega roadshow in Varanasi, drumming up support for BJP candidates ahead of the last phase of the assembly polls in Uttar Pradesh.
